Text: SnApp has a default of a 1000 connections per db-pool category.

While this is totally fine on self-managed installations, it would need to be **tuned for SAS** databases (such as MS Azure) where the number of available connections is limited depending on the plan purchased.
The overall constraint that has to be granted is:
**The total number of SnApp max db-pool connections (Adding up different db-pool categories multiplied by the number of tomcats) have to be lower or minor than the SQLServer limit.**
Overrides the overall SnApp defaults (5 as MIN, 1000 as MAX)
Set a limit for a specific category.\
- **default**: Used by browser interfaces, such as: Backoffice, B2B, CallCenter, Mobile
- **service**: Used by SnApp services (ie: Scheduler, Consolidation queues, etc...) and asynchronous queues (ie: post-processes, outbound-queue)
- **cmd**: Used by APIs. Every API call whose implementation needs DB connection (almost every API) will use 1 connection per call.
This "categorization" concept applies also to the parameter "VGS-DB_poolMin".
Overrides the overall SnApp defaults for connection WAIT and IDLE timeouts.\
SnApp defaults are 10 seconds for WAIT and 10 minutes for IDLE
The "categorization" concept explained above applies to these parameters as well.
